commit_message:
Spec for converge-to-eslint-config-openstack blueprint

Blueprint: converge-to-eslint-config-openstack

Change-Id: I009f1b588ddfca4b426ad6916f9fa130ec3a7dab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-specs refs/changes/39/271439/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================ Converge to OpenStack Javascript Coding Standart ================================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/converge-to-eslint-config-openstack Fuel UI is using independent ESLint config to lint JavaScript code. Since Fuel in a part of OpenStack, we must use OpenStack coding style. ------------------- Problem description ------------------- There is eslint-config-openstack project which contains .eslintrc with rules for all OpenStack projects. Fuel's .eslintrc is significantly different - it contains extra rules and different values. Switching to OpenStack style will make it easier for external contributors to contribute. ---------------- Proposed changes ---------------- Fuel's .eslintrc needs to be rewritten to extend eslint-config-openstack. It's possible to disable some rules from eslint-config-openstack if there is a valid reason, but the number of such rules should be minimal. It's ok for extra rules (which are not present in eslint-config-openstack) to stay. React and ES6 rules should also stay in .eslintrc. Fuel UI code should be updated accordingly. Web UI ====== Fuel UI code needs to be fixed according to the new rules to pass CI. Nailgun ======= Data model ---------- None REST API -------- None Orchestration ============= RPC Protocol ------------ None Fuel Client =========== None Plugins ======= None Fuel Library ============ ------------ Alternatives ------------ None -------------- Upgrade impact -------------- None --------------- Security impact --------------- None -------------------- Notifications impact -------------------- None --------------- End user impact --------------- None ------------------ Performance impact ------------------ None ----------------- Deployment impact ----------------- None ---------------- Developer impact ---------------- It will take some time for active contributors to adapt to the new coding style. For new contributors which are familiar with other OpenStack projects it will be easier to start contributing. --------------------- Infrastructure impact --------------------- None -------------------- Documentation impact -------------------- None -------------- Implementation -------------- Assignee(s) =========== Primary assignee: vkramskikh@mirantis.com Other contributors: astepanchuk@mirantis.com jkirnosova@mirantis.com kpimenova@mirantis.com Mandatory design review: astepanchuk@mirantis.com jkirnosova@mirantis.com kpimenova@mirantis.com Work Items ========== The rules should be enable one-by-one. The diffs can be very large, so it's preferred to finish transition at the beginning of the development cycle to avoid conflicts. Dependencies ============ * eslint-config-openstack NPM module should be added to package.json as a devDependency. ----------- Testing, QA ----------- Fuel CI runs ESLint as a part of verify-fuel-web-ui job, so all the changes are tested automatically. Acceptance criteria =================== The following rules need to be used from eslint-config-openstack (i.e. they shouldn't be overriden in Fuel's .eslintrc): * complexity * eqeqeq * no-script-url * indent * one-var * max-len * no-sync ---------- References ---------- http://eslint.org/ http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/eslint-config-openstack

Kubernetes application; deploys a Kubernetes\ \ cluster with 3 different node types:
 * 1 master node VM running the Kubernetes\ \ API
 * 1 or more minion nodes to be used to host user applications
 *\ \ 0 or more gateway nodes running HAProxy to route external
 traffic to\ \ provide access to services running
 in the Kubernetes cluster.

\ This application deploys all Kubernetes prerequisites, builds the etcd cluster\ \ and the flannel networking cluster and then configures Kubernetes API and\ \ other services, as appropriate for each node type.
The application also provides\ \ API access to other applications, so they can create/delete Kubernetes services\ \ and Pods/Replication Controllers from its JSON definitions.
" service: type: murano format: package package_name: io.murano.apps.docker.kubernetes.KubernetesCluster release: - Kilo license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Interface Library - name: Ubuntu 14.04 x64 (pre-installed Kubernetes) hash: c991ce0d15bffef0fa32d03dc7e76d6e attributes: Package URL: http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/io.murano.apps.docker.kubernetes.KubernetesCluster.zip Source URL: https://github.com/stackforge/murano-apps Documentation: https://github.com/stackforge/murano-apps/blob/master/Docker/Kubernetes/readme.md - name: Kubernetes Pod provided_by: name: Stan Lagun href: mailto:slagun@mirantis.com company: Mirantis, Inc. description: 'Application representing a Kubernetes Pod on a given Kubernetes Cluster This Pod is a co-located set of docker containers which are deployed together on a single node and share single network space. Containers within a single pod can access each other using 127.0.0.1 (localhost). Kubernetes treats Pods as an indivisible deployment unit. This application also encapsulates Kubernetes Replication Controller. User needs to provide a count of replicas; if the number is greater than zero, the Replication Controller is created automatically with the desired number of replicas. The Replication Controller creates clones of the Pod (copies with the same container list). If a Pod dies for any reason (for example, due to hosting minion failure) Replication Controller will create additional Pod replicas on available resources. The Kubernetes Pod provides an API to the host docker container that is compatible with Docker Standalone Host so that any Docker Application can be hosted on any one of them. ' service: type: murano format: package package_name: io.murano.apps.docker.kubernetes.KubernetesPod release: - Kilo license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Interface Library - name: Kubernetes Cluster hash: d16234097d6ba6e69d96248f5d910200 attributes: Package URL: http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/io.murano.apps.docker.kubernetes.KubernetesPod.zip Source URL: https://github.com/stackforge/murano-apps Documentation: https://github.com/stackforge/murano-apps/blob/master/Docker/Kubernetes/readme.md - name: Docker Container tags: - app provided_by: name: Dmitry Dovbii href: mailto:ddovbii@mirantis.com company: Mirantis, Inc. description: 'This application can run any arbitrary docker container, and deploy one of the 13,000+ apps available on Docker Hub at https://registry.hub.docker.com on any supported host implementation (i.e. Kubernetes Pod or Docker Standalone Host).  \ \ 1. Building/testing software projects continuously, just like
 CruiseControl\ \ or DamageControl. In a nutshell, Jenkins provides
 what's known as a\ \ 'continuous integration system', to make
 it easier for developers to\ \ integrate changes to the project,
 and easier for users to obtain a fresh\ \ build. The automated, continuous
 build approach simplifies how new code\ \ gets integrated and consumed.
 2. Monitoring executions of externally-run\ \ jobs, such as cron jobs and
 procmail jobs, even those that are run on\ \ a remote machine.
 For example, with cron, all you receive is regular\ \ e-mails that
 capture the output, and it is up to you to look at them\ \ diligently
 and notice when it broke. Jenkins keeps those outputs and\ \ makes it
 easy for you to notice when something is wrong.

Murano will\ \ deploy this in the docker service of your choice; you'll be prompted to create\ \ a docker service or choose one you have deployed (e.g., via Kubernetes Pod).

Being a fork\ \ of a leading open source software system, it is notable for being led by the\ \ original developers of MySQL, who forked it due to concerns over its acquisition\ \ by Oracle. Contributors are required to share their copyright with the MariaDB\ \ Foundation.
The intent is also to maintain high compatibility with MySQL,\ \ ensuring a “drop-in” replacement capability with library binary\ \ equivalency and exact matching with MySQL APIs and commands. It includes the\ \ XtraDB storage engine for replacing InnoDB, as well as a new storage engine,\ \ Aria, that intends to be both a transactional and non-transactional engine\ \ perhaps even included in future versions of MySQL.
Murano will deploy this\ \ in the docker service of your choice; you'll be prompted to create a docker\ \ service or choose one you have deployed (e.g., via Kubernetes Pod).

Classified as a NoSQL database, MongoDB eschews the traditional\ \ table-based relational database structure in favor of JSON-like documents\ \ with dynamic schemas (MongoDB calls the format BSON), making the integration\ \ of data in certain types of applications easier and faster. Released under\ \ a combination of the GNU Affero General Public License and the Apache License,\ \ MongoDB is free and open-source software.
First developed by the software\ \ company 10gen (now MongoDB Inc.) in October 2007 as a component of a planned\ \ platform as a service product, the company shifted to an open source development\ \ model in 2009, with 10gen offering commercial support and other services.\ \ Since then, MongoDB has been adopted as backend software by a number of major\ \ websites and services, including Craigslist, eBay, Foursquare, SourceForge,\ \ Viacom, and the New York Times, among others. MongoDB is the most popular\ \ NoSQL database system.

SQL is the most popular language for adding, accessing and managing content in a database. It is most noted for its quick processing, proven reliability, ease and flexibility of use. Murano will deploy this in the docker service of your choice; you''ll be prompted to create a docker service or choose one you have deployed (e.g., via Kubernetes Pod). ' service: type: murano format: package package_name: io.murano.apps.docker.DockerMySQL release: - Kilo - Liberty license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Standalone Host - name: Kubernetes Pod - name: Docker Interfaces Library hash: 25f0a51d04c6959214dc28ebf443497f attributes: Package URL: http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/io.murano.apps.docker.DockerMySQL.zip Source URL: https://github.com/openstack/murano-apps/tree/master/Docker/Applications/MySQL/package - name: Docker Nginx tags: - app provided_by: name: Dmitry Dovbii href: mailto:ddovbii@mirantis.com company: Mirantis, Inc. description: "Nginx (pronounced “engine-x”) is an open source reverse\ \ proxy server for HTTP, HTTPS, SMTP, POP3, and IMAP protocols, as well as a\ \ load balancer, HTTP cache, and a web server (origin server).
The Nginx project\ \ started with a strong focus on high concurrency, high performance and low\ \ memory usage. It is licensed under the 2-clause BSD-like license and it runs\ \ on Linux, BSD variants, Mac OS X, Solaris, AIX, HP-UX, as well as on other\ \ *nix flavors.
Murano will deploy this in the docker service of your choice;\ \ you'll be prompted to create a docker service or choose one you have deployed\ \ (e.g., via Kubernetes Pod).
" service: type: murano format: package package_name: io.murano.apps.docker.DockerNginx release: - Kilo - Liberty license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Standalone Host - name: Kubernetes Pod - name: Docker Interfaces Library hash: 4bb119bd0434b865fffbf9c44a44d65f attributes: Package URL: http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/io.murano.apps.docker.DockerNginx.zip Source URL: https://github.com/openstack/murano-apps/tree/master/Docker/Applications/Nginx/package - name: Docker Nginx Site tags: - app provided_by: name: Dmitry Dovbii href: mailto:ddovbii@mirantis.com company: Mirantis, Inc. description: "Nginx (pronounced “engine-x”) is an open source reverse\ \ proxy server for HTTP, HTTPS, SMTP, POP3, and IMAP protocols, as well as a\ \ load balancer, HTTP cache, and a web server (origin server).
The Nginx project\ \ started with a strong focus on high concurrency, high performance and low\ \ memory usage. It is licensed under the 2-clause BSD-like license and it runs\ \ on Linux, BSD variants, Mac OS X, Solaris, AIX, HP-UX, as well as on other\ \ *nix flavors.
This applications deploys a web-site from a git URL using Nginx\ \ as the web server.
Murano will deploy this in the docker service of your\ \ choice; you'll be prompted to create a docker service or choose one you have\ \ deployed (e.g., via Kubernetes Pod).
" service: type: murano format: package package_name: io.murano.apps.docker.DockerNginxSite release: - Kilo - Liberty license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Standalone Host - name: Kubernetes Pod - name: Docker Interfaces Library hash: 3cf9aae5bd1c77faa99e88537317a289 attributes: Package URL: http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/io.murano.apps.docker.DockerNginxSite.zip Source URL: https://github.com/openstack/murano-apps/tree/master/Docker/Applications/NginxSite/package - name: Docker PostgreSQL tags: - app provided_by: name: Dmitry Dovbii href: mailto:ddovbii@mirantis.com company: Mirantis, Inc. description: "PostgreSQL, often simply “Postgres”, is an object-relational\ \ database management system (ORDBMS) with an emphasis on extensibility and\ \ standards-compliance. As a database server, its primary function is to store\ \ data, securely and supporting best practices, and retrieve it later, as requested\ \ by other software applications, be it those on the same computer or those\ \ running on another computer across a network (including the Internet). It\ \ can handle workloads ranging from small single-machine applications to large\ \ Internet-facing applications with many concurrent users. Recent versions also\ \ provide replication of the database itself for security and scalability.
\ PostgreSQL implements the majority of the SQL:2011 standard, is ACID-compliant\ \ and transactional (including most DDL statements) avoiding locking issues\ \ using multiversion concurrency control (MVCC), provides immunity to dirty\ \ reads and full serializability; handles complex SQL queries using many indexing\ \ methods that are not available in other databases; has updateable views and\ \ materialized views, triggers, foreign keys; supports functions and stored\ \ procedures, and other expandability, and has a large number of extensions\ \ written by third parties.
In addition to the possibility of working with\ \ the major proprietary and open source databases, PostgreSQL supports migration\ \ from them, by its extensive standard SQL support and available migration tools.\ \ And if proprietary extensions had been used, by its extensibility that can\ \ emulate many through some built-in and third-party open source.
Murano will\ \ deploy this in the docker service of your choice; you'll be prompted to create\ \ a docker service or choose one you have deployed (e.g., via Kubernetes Pod).
" service: type: murano format: package package_name: io.murano.apps.docker.DockerPostgreSQL release: - Kilo - Liberty license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Standalone Host - name: Kubernetes Pod - name: Docker Interfaces Library hash: 4d0200b151c6d50800d433283080888c attributes: Package URL: http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/io.murano.apps.docker.DockerPostgreSQL.zip Source URL: https://github.com/openstack/murano-apps/tree/master/Docker/Applications/PostgreSQL/package - name: Docker Redis tags: - app provided_by: name: Dmitry Dovbii href: mailto:ddovbii@mirantis.com company: Mirantis, Inc. description: 'Redis is an open-source, networked, in-memory, key-value data store with optional durability. It is written in ANSI C. The development of Redis has been sponsored by Pivotal since May 2013; before that, it was sponsored by VMware. According to the monthly ranking by DB-Engines.com, Redis is the most popular key-value store. The name Redis means REmote DIctionary Server. Murano will deploy this in the docker service of your choice; you''ll be prompted to create a docker service or choose one you have deployed (e.g., via Kubernetes Pod). ' service: type: murano format: package package_name: io.murano.apps.docker.DockerRedis release: - Kilo - Liberty license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Standalone Host - name: Kubernetes Pod - name: Docker Interfaces Library hash: f725f78055f300c4ef8f37a69a81b5ce attributes: Package URL: http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/io.murano.apps.docker.DockerRedis.zip Source URL: https://github.com/openstack/murano-apps/tree/master/Docker/Applications/Redis/package - name: Docker Tomcat tags: - app provided_by: name: Dmitry Dovbii href: mailto:ddovbii@mirantis.com company: Mirantis, Inc. description: "Apache Tomcat (or simply Tomcat) is an open source web server and\ \ servlet container developed by the Apache Software Foundation (ASF). Tomcat\ \ implements the Java Servlet and the JavaServer Pages (JSP) specifications\ \ from Oracle, and provides a “pure Java” HTTP web server environment\ \ for Java code to run in. In the simplest config Tomcat runs in a single operating\ \ system process. The process runs a Java virtual machine (JVM). Every single\ \ HTTP request from a browser to Tomcat is processed in the Tomcat process in\ \ a separate thread.
Murano will deploy this in the docker service of your\ \ choice; you'll be prompted to create a docker service or choose one you have\ \ deployed (e.g., via Kubernetes Pod).
" service: type: murano format: package package_name: io.murano.apps.docker.DockerTomcat release: - Kilo - Liberty license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Standalone Host - name: Kubernetes Pod - name: Docker Interfaces Library hash: b470fb1788d423a6e627b30137659a88 attributes: Package URL: http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/io.murano.apps.docker.DockerTomcat.zip Source URL: https://github.com/openstack/murano-apps/tree/master/Docker/Applications/Tomcat/package - name: Application Servers Bundle provided_by: name: Serg Melikyan href: mailto:smelikyan@mirantis.com company: Mirantis, Inc. description: 'A bundle is the collection of Murano applications and their dependencies. Bundles are designed to allow the user to consume a group of related applications to address a particular use-case. Adding a bundle to Murano provides automated download of all the applications associated with that bundle at the same time. This bundle contains the Apache HTTP Server and Apache Tomcat: an open source server-side executive for Java Servlets and JavaServer Pages. The bundle provides a flexible, familiar environment for developing websites and applications that use Java for server-side processing. Each request from a browser is processed by Tomcat in a separate thread. ' service: type: bundle murano_package_name: app-servers release: - Kilo license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Apache HTTP Server - name: Apache Tomcat - name: Container-based Apps Bundle provided_by: name: Serg Melikyan href: mailto:smelikyan@mirantis.com company: Mirantis, Inc. description: "A bundle is the collection of Murano applications and their dependencies.\ \ Bundles are designed to allow the user to consume a group of related applications\ \ to address a particular use-case. Adding a bundle to Murano provides automated\ \ download of all the applications associated with that bundle at the same time.
\ This bundle contains a wide range of apps for building (from Git), continuously-integrating,\ \ deploying and testing container-native, resilient and scalable data-driven\ \ and transaction-driven websites and applications. All components in this bundle\ \ can be deployed on DockerStandaloneHost or KubernetesPod/Cluster. Included\ \ in the bundle are:
 * Web server options: Market-leading Apache and high-performing,
\ \ tunable Nginx, in simplex versions as well as versions rigged
 to\ \ automatically deploy a website from a given Git repository.
 * Java engine\ \ options: Glassfish application server
 (open source Java EE) and Tomcat.
\ \ * NoSQL and specialized databases: InfluxDB for storing
 metrics and\ \ sensor data (with no external dependencies).
 MongoDB for object/document\ \ storage, Redis for key/value storage.
 * Leading SQL databases: MySQL,\ \ the increasingly-popular MariaDB
 and Crate for massively-scalable elastic\ \ SQL storage.
 * Grafana for visualizing large-scale measurement data.
\ \ * Plus: Jenkins for automating continuous builds
 and monitoring remote\ \ job execution.
" service: type: bundle murano_package_name: container-based-apps release: - Kilo license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Crate - name: Docker Container - name: Docker GlassFish - name: Docker Grafana - name: Docker HTTPd - name: Docker HTTPd Site - name: Docker InfluxDB - name: Docker Jenkins - name: Docker MariaDB - name: Docker MongoDB - name: Docker MySQL - name: Docker Nginx - name: Docker Nginx Site - name: Docker PostgreSQL - name: Docker Redis - name: Docker Tomcat - name: Databases Bundle provided_by: name: Serg Melikyan href: mailto:smelikyan@mirantis.com company: Mirantis, Inc. description: 'A bundle is the collection of Murano applications and their dependencies. Bundles are designed to allow the user to consume a group of related applications to address a particular use-case. Adding a bundle to Murano provides automated download of all the applications associated with that bundle at the same time. This bundle groups popular database solutions that are useful for developling applications. Currently this bundle contains Postgres and MySQL, but as new databases are added to the catalog this bundle will grow to include them. ' service: type: bundle murano_package_name: databases release: - Kilo license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: MySQL - name: PostgreSql - name: Docker & Kubernetes Bundle provided_by: name: Serg Melikyan href: mailto:smelikyan@mirantis.com company: Mirantis, Inc. description: 'A bundle is the collection of Murano applications and their dependencies. Bundles are designed to allow the user to consume a group of related applications to address a particular use-case. Adding a bundle to Murano provides automated download of all the applications associated with that bundle at the same time. This bundle contains Docker Standalone Host and Kubernetes Pod: two ways (both compatible with any Docker-containerized app and both offering access to standard Docker APIs) of aggregating groups of related Docker containers on host compute/storage and network infrastructure, and treating these aggregations as indivisible deployment units. Kubernetes Pod also contains the Kubernetes Replication Controller, which can auto-replicate and redeploy a Pod with given contents in the event of Pod failure. ' service: type: bundle murano_package_name: docker-n-kubernetes release: - Kilo license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Standalone Host - name: Kubernetes Pod - name: Monitoring Bundle provided_by: name: Serg Melikyan href: mailto:smelikyan@mirantis.com company: Mirantis, Inc. description: 'A bundle is the collection of Murano applications and their dependencies. Bundles are designed to allow the user to consume a group of related applications to address a particular use-case. Adding a bundle to Murano provides automated download of all the applications associated with that bundle at the same time. This bundle contains the Zabbix Agent and Server. Zabbix is the ultimate enterprise-level software designed for monitoring availability and performance of IT infrastructure components. With Zabbix it is possible to gather virtually limitless types of data from the network. High performance real-time monitoring means that tens of thousands of servers, virtual machines and network devices can be monitored simultaneously. Along with storing the data, visualization features are available (overviews, maps, graphs, screens, etc), as well as very flexible ways of analyzing the data for the purpose of alerting. ' service: type: bundle murano_package_name: monitoring release: - Kilo license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Zabbix Agent - name: Zabbix

Standalone docker implementation; employs single VM running docker service. Kubernetes application; deploys a Kubernetes cluster with 3 different node types: * 1 master node VM running the Kubernetes API * 1 or more minion nodes to be used to host user applications * 0 or more gateway nodes running HAProxy to route external traffic to provide access to services running in the Kubernetes cluster. This application deploys all Kubernetes prerequisites, builds the etcd cluster and the flannel networking cluster and then configures Kubernetes API and other services, as appropriate for each node type. The application also provides API access to other applications, so they can create/delete Kubernetes services and Pods/Replication Controllers from its JSON definitions. service: type: murano format: package package_name: io.murano.apps.docker.kubernetes.KubernetesCluster release: - Kilo license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Interface Library - name: Ubuntu 14.04 x64 (pre-installed Kubernetes) hash: c991ce0d15bffef0fa32d03dc7e76d6e attributes: "Package URL": "http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/io.murano.apps.docker.kubernetes.KubernetesCluster.zip" "Source URL": "https://github.com/stackforge/murano-apps" Documentation: "https://github.com/stackforge/murano-apps/blob/master/Docker/Kubernetes/readme.md" - name: Kubernetes Pod provided_by: name: Stan Lagun href: "mailto:slagun@mirantis.com" company: Mirantis, Inc. description: > Application representing a Kubernetes Pod on a given Kubernetes Cluster This Pod is a co-located set of docker containers which are deployed together on a single node and share single network space. Containers within a single pod can access each other using 127.0.0.1 (localhost). Kubernetes treats Pods as an indivisible deployment unit. This application also encapsulates Kubernetes Replication Controller. User needs to provide a count of replicas; if the number is greater than zero, the Replication Controller is created automatically with the desired number of replicas. The Replication Controller creates clones of the Pod (copies with the same container list). If a Pod dies for any reason (for example, due to hosting minion failure) Replication Controller will create additional Pod replicas on available resources. The Kubernetes Pod provides an API to the host docker container that is compatible with Docker Standalone Host so that any Docker Application can be hosted on any one of them. service: type: murano format: package package_name: io.murano.apps.docker.kubernetes.KubernetesPod release: - Kilo license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Interface Library - name: Kubernetes Cluster hash: d16234097d6ba6e69d96248f5d910200 attributes: "Package URL": "http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/io.murano.apps.docker.kubernetes.KubernetesPod.zip" "Source URL": "https://github.com/stackforge/murano-apps" Documentation: "https://github.com/stackforge/murano-apps/blob/master/Docker/Kubernetes/readme.md" - name: Docker Container tags: ['app'] provided_by: name: Dmitry Dovbii href: "mailto:ddovbii@mirantis.com" company: Mirantis, Inc. description: > This application can run any arbitrary docker container, and deploy one of the 13,000+ apps available on Docker Hub at https://registry.hub.docker.com on any supported host implementation (i.e. Kubernetes Pod or Docker Standalone Host). GlassFish is free software, dual-licensed under two free software licenses: the Common Development and Distribution License (CDDL) and the GNU General Public License (GPL) with the classpath exception. GlassFish is the reference implementation of Java EE and as such supports Enterprise JavaBeans, JPA, JavaServer Faces, JMS, RMI, JavaServer Pages, servlets, etc. This allows developers to create enterprise applications that are portable and scalable, and that integrate with legacy technologies. Grafana is most commonly used for Internet infrastructure and application analytics, but many use it in other domains including industrial sensors, home automation, weather, and process control. Grafana features pluggable panels and data sources allowing easy extensibility. There is currently rich support for Graphite, InfluxDB and OpenTSDB. There is also experimental support for KairosDB, and SQL is on the roadmap. Grafana has a variety of panels, including a fully featured graph panel with rich visualization options. Among those things, current Jenkins focuses on the following two jobs: 1. Building/testing software projects continuously, just like CruiseControl or DamageControl. In a nutshell, Jenkins provides what's known as a 'continuous integration system', to make it easier for developers to integrate changes to the project, and easier for users to obtain a fresh build. The automated, continuous build approach simplifies how new code gets integrated and consumed. 2. Monitoring executions of externally-run jobs, such as cron jobs and procmail jobs, even those that are run on a remote machine. For example, with cron, all you receive is regular e-mails that capture the output, and it is up to you to look at them diligently and notice when it broke. Jenkins keeps those outputs and makes it easy for you to notice when something is wrong. Murano will deploy this in the docker service of your choice; you'll be prompted to create a docker service or choose one you have deployed (e.g., via Kubernetes Pod). service: type: murano format: package package_name: io.murano.apps.docker.DockerJenkins release: - Kilo - Liberty license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Standalone Host - name: Kubernetes Pod - name: Docker Interfaces Library hash: 816a32598ca7a12b5db8f3d6d598e8bf attributes: "Package URL": "http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/io.murano.apps.docker.DockerJenkins.zip" "Source URL": "https://github.com/openstack/murano-apps/tree/master/Docker/Applications/Jenkins/package" - name: Docker MariaDB tags: ['app'] provided_by: name: Dmitry Dovbii href: "mailto:ddovbii@mirantis.com" company: Mirantis, Inc. description: > MariaDB is a community-developed fork of the MySQL relational database management system intended to remain free under the GNU GPL. Being a fork of a leading open source software system, it is notable for being led by the original developers of MySQL, who forked it due to concerns over its acquisition by Oracle. Contributors are required to share their copyright with the MariaDB Foundation. The intent is also to maintain high compatibility with MySQL, ensuring a “drop-in” replacement capability with library binary equivalency and exact matching with MySQL APIs and commands. It includes the XtraDB storage engine for replacing InnoDB, as well as a new storage engine, Aria, that intends to be both a transactional and non-transactional engine perhaps even included in future versions of MySQL. Murano will deploy this in the docker service of your choice; you'll be prompted to create a docker service or choose one you have deployed (e.g., via Kubernetes Pod). service: type: murano format: package package_name: io.murano.apps.docker.DockerMariaDB release: - Kilo - Liberty license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Standalone Host - name: Kubernetes Pod - name: Docker Interfaces Library hash: d2b66714adba398045199019d2a1dd3a attributes: "Package URL": "http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/io.murano.apps.docker.DockerMariaDB.zip" "Source URL": "https://github.com/openstack/murano-apps/tree/master/Docker/Applications/MariaDB/package" - name: Docker MongoDB tags: ['app'] provided_by: name: Dmitry Dovbii href: "mailto:ddovbii@mirantis.com" company: Mirantis, Inc. description: > MongoDB (as in “humongous”) is a cross-platform document-oriented database. Classified as a NoSQL database, MongoDB eschews the traditional table-based relational database structure in favor of JSON-like documents with dynamic schemas (MongoDB calls the format BSON), making the integration of data in certain types of applications easier and faster. Released under a combination of the GNU Affero General Public License and the Apache License, MongoDB is free and open-source software. First developed by the software company 10gen (now MongoDB Inc.) in October 2007 as a component of a planned platform as a service product, the company shifted to an open source development model in 2009, with 10gen offering commercial support and other services. Since then, MongoDB has been adopted as backend software by a number of major websites and services, including Craigslist, eBay, Foursquare, SourceForge, Viacom, and the New York Times, among others. MongoDB is the most popular NoSQL database system. Murano will deploy this in the docker service of your choice; you'll be prompted to create a docker service or choose one you have deployed (e.g., via Kubernetes Pod). service: type: murano format: package package_name: io.murano.apps.docker.DockerMongoDB release: - Kilo - Liberty license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Standalone Host - name: Kubernetes Pod - name: Docker Interfaces Library hash: a0f99ae24cdc7c5da7f62cc8bb919f64 attributes: "Package URL": "http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/io.murano.apps.docker.DockerMongoDB.zip" "Source URL": "https://github.com/openstack/murano-apps/tree/master/Docker/Applications/MongoDB/package" - name: Docker MySQL tags: ['app'] provided_by: name: Dmitry Dovbii href: "mailto:ddovbii@mirantis.com" company: Mirantis, Inc. description: > MySQL is a freely available open source Relational Database Management System (RDBMS) that uses Structured Query Language (SQL). SQL is the most popular language for adding, accessing and managing content in a database. It is most noted for its quick processing, proven reliability, ease and flexibility of use. Murano will deploy this in the docker service of your choice; you'll be prompted to create a docker service or choose one you have deployed (e.g., via Kubernetes Pod). service: type: murano format: package package_name: io.murano.apps.docker.DockerMySQL release: - Kilo - Liberty license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Standalone Host - name: Kubernetes Pod - name: Docker Interfaces Library hash: 25f0a51d04c6959214dc28ebf443497f attributes: "Package URL": "http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/io.murano.apps.docker.DockerMySQL.zip" "Source URL": "https://github.com/openstack/murano-apps/tree/master/Docker/Applications/MySQL/package" - name: Docker Nginx tags: ['app'] provided_by: name: Dmitry Dovbii href: "mailto:ddovbii@mirantis.com" company: Mirantis, Inc. description: > Nginx (pronounced “engine-x”) is an open source reverse proxy server for HTTP, HTTPS, SMTP, POP3, and IMAP protocols, as well as a load balancer, HTTP cache, and a web server (origin server). The Nginx project started with a strong focus on high concurrency, high performance and low memory usage. It is licensed under the 2-clause BSD-like license and it runs on Linux, BSD variants, Mac OS X, Solaris, AIX, HP-UX, as well as on other *nix flavors. Murano will deploy this in the docker service of your choice; you'll be prompted to create a docker service or choose one you have deployed (e.g., via Kubernetes Pod). service: type: murano format: package package_name: io.murano.apps.docker.DockerNginx release: - Kilo - Liberty license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Standalone Host - name: Kubernetes Pod - name: Docker Interfaces Library hash: 4bb119bd0434b865fffbf9c44a44d65f attributes: "Package URL": "http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/io.murano.apps.docker.DockerNginx.zip" "Source URL": "https://github.com/openstack/murano-apps/tree/master/Docker/Applications/Nginx/package" - name: Docker Nginx Site tags: ['app'] provided_by: name: Dmitry Dovbii href: "mailto:ddovbii@mirantis.com" company: Mirantis, Inc. description: > Nginx (pronounced “engine-x”) is an open source reverse proxy server for HTTP, HTTPS, SMTP, POP3, and IMAP protocols, as well as a load balancer, HTTP cache, and a web server (origin server). The Nginx project started with a strong focus on high concurrency, high performance and low memory usage. It is licensed under the 2-clause BSD-like license and it runs on Linux, BSD variants, Mac OS X, Solaris, AIX, HP-UX, as well as on other *nix flavors. This applications deploys a web-site from a git URL using Nginx as the web server. Murano will deploy this in the docker service of your choice; you'll be prompted to create a docker service or choose one you have deployed (e.g., via Kubernetes Pod). service: type: murano format: package package_name: io.murano.apps.docker.DockerNginxSite release: - Kilo - Liberty license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Standalone Host - name: Kubernetes Pod - name: Docker Interfaces Library hash: 3cf9aae5bd1c77faa99e88537317a289 attributes: "Package URL": "http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/io.murano.apps.docker.DockerNginxSite.zip" "Source URL": "https://github.com/openstack/murano-apps/tree/master/Docker/Applications/NginxSite/package" - name: Docker PostgreSQL tags: ['app'] provided_by: name: Dmitry Dovbii href: "mailto:ddovbii@mirantis.com" company: Mirantis, Inc. description: > PostgreSQL, often simply “Postgres”, is an object-relational database management system (ORDBMS) with an emphasis on extensibility and standards-compliance. As a database server, its primary function is to store data, securely and supporting best practices, and retrieve it later, as requested by other software applications, be it those on the same computer or those running on another computer across a network (including the Internet). It can handle workloads ranging from small single-machine applications to large Internet-facing applications with many concurrent users. Recent versions also provide replication of the database itself for security and scalability. PostgreSQL implements the majority of the SQL:2011 standard, is ACID-compliant and transactional (including most DDL statements) avoiding locking issues using multiversion concurrency control (MVCC), provides immunity to dirty reads and full serializability; handles complex SQL queries using many indexing methods that are not available in other databases; has updateable views and materialized views, triggers, foreign keys; supports functions and stored procedures, and other expandability, and has a large number of extensions written by third parties. In addition to the possibility of working with the major proprietary and open source databases, PostgreSQL supports migration from them, by its extensive standard SQL support and available migration tools. And if proprietary extensions had been used, by its extensibility that can emulate many through some built-in and third-party open source. Murano will deploy this in the docker service of your choice; you'll be prompted to create a docker service or choose one you have deployed (e.g., via Kubernetes Pod). service: type: murano format: package package_name: io.murano.apps.docker.DockerPostgreSQL release: - Kilo - Liberty license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Standalone Host - name: Kubernetes Pod - name: Docker Interfaces Library hash: 4d0200b151c6d50800d433283080888c attributes: "Package URL": "http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/io.murano.apps.docker.DockerPostgreSQL.zip" "Source URL": "https://github.com/openstack/murano-apps/tree/master/Docker/Applications/PostgreSQL/package" - name: Docker Redis tags: ['app'] provided_by: name: Dmitry Dovbii href: "mailto:ddovbii@mirantis.com" company: Mirantis, Inc. description: > Redis is an open-source, networked, in-memory, key-value data store with optional durability. It is written in ANSI C. The development of Redis has been sponsored by Pivotal since May 2013; before that, it was sponsored by VMware. According to the monthly ranking by DB-Engines.com, Redis is the most popular key-value store. The name Redis means REmote DIctionary Server. Murano will deploy this in the docker service of your choice; you'll be prompted to create a docker service or choose one you have deployed (e.g., via Kubernetes Pod). service: type: murano format: package package_name: io.murano.apps.docker.DockerRedis release: - Kilo - Liberty license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Standalone Host - name: Kubernetes Pod - name: Docker Interfaces Library hash: f725f78055f300c4ef8f37a69a81b5ce attributes: "Package URL": "http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/io.murano.apps.docker.DockerRedis.zip" "Source URL": "https://github.com/openstack/murano-apps/tree/master/Docker/Applications/Redis/package" - name: Docker Tomcat tags: ['app'] provided_by: name: Dmitry Dovbii href: "mailto:ddovbii@mirantis.com" company: Mirantis, Inc. description: > Apache Tomcat (or simply Tomcat) is an open source web server and servlet container developed by the Apache Software Foundation (ASF). Tomcat implements the Java Servlet and the JavaServer Pages (JSP) specifications from Oracle, and provides a “pure Java” HTTP web server environment for Java code to run in. In the simplest config Tomcat runs in a single operating system process. The process runs a Java virtual machine (JVM). Every single HTTP request from a browser to Tomcat is processed in the Tomcat process in a separate thread. Murano will deploy this in the docker service of your choice; you'll be prompted to create a docker service or choose one you have deployed (e.g., via Kubernetes Pod). service: type: murano format: package package_name: io.murano.apps.docker.DockerTomcat release: - Kilo - Liberty license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Standalone Host - name: Kubernetes Pod - name: Docker Interfaces Library hash: b470fb1788d423a6e627b30137659a88 attributes: "Package URL": "http://storage.apps.openstack.org/apps/io.murano.apps.docker.DockerTomcat.zip" "Source URL": "https://github.com/openstack/murano-apps/tree/master/Docker/Applications/Tomcat/package" - name: Application Servers Bundle provided_by: name: Serg Melikyan href: "mailto:smelikyan@mirantis.com" company: Mirantis, Inc. description: > A bundle is the collection of Murano applications and their dependencies. Bundles are designed to allow the user to consume a group of related applications to address a particular use-case. Adding a bundle to Murano provides automated download of all the applications associated with that bundle at the same time. This bundle contains the Apache HTTP Server and Apache Tomcat: an open source server-side executive for Java Servlets and JavaServer Pages. The bundle provides a flexible, familiar environment for developing websites and applications that use Java for server-side processing. Each request from a browser is processed by Tomcat in a separate thread. service: type: bundle murano_package_name: app-servers release: - Kilo license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Apache HTTP Server - name: Apache Tomcat - name: Container-based Apps Bundle provided_by: name: Serg Melikyan href: "mailto:smelikyan@mirantis.com" company: Mirantis, Inc. description: > A bundle is the collection of Murano applications and their dependencies. Bundles are designed to allow the user to consume a group of related applications to address a particular use-case. Adding a bundle to Murano provides automated download of all the applications associated with that bundle at the same time. This bundle contains a wide range of apps for building (from Git), continuously-integrating, deploying and testing container-native, resilient and scalable data-driven and transaction-driven websites and applications. All components in this bundle can be deployed on DockerStandaloneHost or KubernetesPod/Cluster. Included in the bundle are: * Web server options: Market-leading Apache and high-performing, tunable Nginx, in simplex versions as well as versions rigged to automatically deploy a website from a given Git repository. * Java engine options: Glassfish application server (open source Java EE) and Tomcat. * NoSQL and specialized databases: InfluxDB for storing metrics and sensor data (with no external dependencies). MongoDB for object/document storage, Redis for key/value storage. * Leading SQL databases: MySQL, the increasingly-popular MariaDB and Crate for massively-scalable elastic SQL storage. * Grafana for visualizing large-scale measurement data. * Plus: Jenkins for automating continuous builds and monitoring remote job execution. service: type: bundle murano_package_name: container-based-apps release: - Kilo license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Crate - name: Docker Container - name: Docker GlassFish - name: Docker Grafana - name: Docker HTTPd - name: Docker HTTPd Site - name: Docker InfluxDB - name: Docker Jenkins - name: Docker MariaDB - name: Docker MongoDB - name: Docker MySQL - name: Docker Nginx - name: Docker Nginx Site - name: Docker PostgreSQL - name: Docker Redis - name: Docker Tomcat - name: Databases Bundle provided_by: name: Serg Melikyan href: "mailto:smelikyan@mirantis.com" company: Mirantis, Inc. description: > A bundle is the collection of Murano applications and their dependencies. Bundles are designed to allow the user to consume a group of related applications to address a particular use-case. Adding a bundle to Murano provides automated download of all the applications associated with that bundle at the same time. This bundle groups popular database solutions that are useful for developling applications. Currently this bundle contains Postgres and MySQL, but as new databases are added to the catalog this bundle will grow to include them. service: type: bundle murano_package_name: databases release: - Kilo license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: MySQL - name: PostgreSql - name: Docker & Kubernetes Bundle provided_by: name: Serg Melikyan href: "mailto:smelikyan@mirantis.com" company: Mirantis, Inc. description: > A bundle is the collection of Murano applications and their dependencies. Bundles are designed to allow the user to consume a group of related applications to address a particular use-case. Adding a bundle to Murano provides automated download of all the applications associated with that bundle at the same time. This bundle contains Docker Standalone Host and Kubernetes Pod: two ways (both compatible with any Docker-containerized app and both offering access to standard Docker APIs) of aggregating groups of related Docker containers on host compute/storage and network infrastructure, and treating these aggregations as indivisible deployment units. Kubernetes Pod also contains the Kubernetes Replication Controller, which can auto-replicate and redeploy a Pod with given contents in the event of Pod failure. service: type: bundle murano_package_name: docker-n-kubernetes release: - Kilo license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Docker Standalone Host - name: Kubernetes Pod - name: Monitoring Bundle provided_by: name: Serg Melikyan href: "mailto:smelikyan@mirantis.com" company: Mirantis, Inc. description: > A bundle is the collection of Murano applications and their dependencies. Bundles are designed to allow the user to consume a group of related applications to address a particular use-case. Adding a bundle to Murano provides automated download of all the applications associated with that bundle at the same time. This bundle contains the Zabbix Agent and Server. Zabbix is the ultimate enterprise-level software designed for monitoring availability and performance of IT infrastructure components. With Zabbix it is possible to gather virtually limitless types of data from the network. High performance real-time monitoring means that tens of thousands of servers, virtual machines and network devices can be monitored simultaneously. Along with storing the data, visualization features are available (overviews, maps, graphs, screens, etc), as well as very flexible ways of analyzing the data for the purpose of alerting. service: type: bundle murano_package_name: monitoring release: - Kilo license: Multi-licensed OpenSource depends: - name: Zabbix Agent - name: Zabbix

Now that the IPAM work is complete, default "enable_dhcp" to True again.

commit_message:
Update resource type exceptions with error_code

Adds the error_code for resource type exceptions and
for resource type error code starts with 99xxx.

implements blueprint heat-template-validate-improvements

Change-Id: Id73cfd06bfb28e15a52696757bb9f10cbe2596e3

commit_message:
Remove deprecated options dhcp_domain & dhcp_delete_namespaces

- Remove dhcp_delete_namespaces as deprecated according to [0]
- Remove dhcp_domain as deprecated according to [1]
- Allow customization of dns_domain (which replaces dhcp_domain) option
in neutron.conf

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1418079
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/liberty/config-reference/content/section_neutron-dhcp_agent.ini.html

Change-Id: Ic39632bd4b5a5cca2f8cc30527adf566f997bb96

commit_message:
Update the TOSCA NFV definitions with corrected capablity derivations

  - Updated the VirtualLinkable and VirtualBindable capability definitions
    to be derived_from the associated tosca.capabilities.network.LinksTo
    and BindsTo, instead of from ConnectsTo

Change-Id: Ibb63f6bef22ec3ecaf68336f10235defaad3c585
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tosca-parser refs/changes/95/273295/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines: if args.limit and args.admin_tenant in args.limit: print "Pruning the admin project is not allowed!" sys.exit(1) delete_sql = """ %s); """ admin_clause = "AND def.tenant_id = '%s' AND def.name like 'vm.%%'" % \ admin_id if args.limit: print "Limiting pruning to projects '%s'" % args.limit limited_in_list = get_tenant_id_in_list(tenants, args.limit) non_admin_with_limit_clause = \ "AND def.tenant_id != '%s' AND def.tenant_id IN (%s)" \ % (admin_id, limited_in_list) vsql(delete_sql % (retain_time, non_admin_with_limit_clause)) elif args.ignore: print "Ignoring pruning for projects '%s'" % args.ignore ignore_in_list = get_tenant_id_in_list(tenants, args.ignore) non_admin_with_ignore_clause = \ "AND def.tenant_id != '%s' AND def.tenant_id NOT IN (%s)" \ % (admin_id, ignore_in_list) vsql(delete_sql % (retain_time, non_admin_with_ignore_clause)) vsql(delete_sql % (retain_time, admin_clause)) else: non_admin_clause = "AND def.tenant_id != '%s'" % admin_id vsql(delete_sql % (retain_time, non_admin_clause)) vsql(delete_sql % (retain_time, admin_clause))

subject: Renew auth token in delete_cleaning_ports() Neutron provider
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-01 10:10:21.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/dhcp/neutron.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/dhcp/test_neutron.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/5a6bf47d9dd6c4ed101185c764ea7d4fe07d5b21', 'message': "Renew auth token in delete_cleaning_ports() Neutron provider

When cleaning is not async auth token can be expired while node
tear down, this caused error on delete Neutron's cleaning port.
This patch adds renew a token when it's near expiration.

Closes-bug: #1521548
Change-Id: Ia0b4f35878708e861e2dd7bbcd372409ebf4a129
"}]
commit_message:
Renew auth token in delete_cleaning_ports() Neutron provider

When cleaning is not async auth token can be expired while node
tear down, this caused error on delete Neutron's cleaning port.
This patch adds renew a token when it's near expiration.

Closes-bug: #1521548
Change-Id: Ia0b4f35878708e861e2dd7bbcd372409ebf4a129
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/61/251761/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from ironic.common import keystone @mock.patch.object(keystone, 'get_admin_auth_token') @mock.patch.object(keystone, 'token_expires_soon') def test_delete_cleaning_ports(self, list_mock, delete_mock, expires_mock, admin_mock): # task.context.auth_token is None here self.assertFalse(expires_mock.called) self.assertFalse(admin_mock.called) @mock.patch.object(neutron, '_build_client') @mock.patch.object(keystone, 'get_admin_auth_token') @mock.patch.object(keystone, 'token_expires_soon', return_value=True) def test_delete_cleaning_ports_renew_token(self, expires_mock, admin_mock, build_mock): api = dhcp_factory.DHCPFactory().provider self.context.auth_token = 'fake-token' admin_mock.return_value = 'new-token' with task_manager.acquire(self.context, self.node.uuid) as task: api.delete_cleaning_ports(task) expires_mock.assert_called_once_with('fake-token') admin_mock.assert_called_once_with() build_mock.assert_called_once_with('new-token')

commit_message:
Improve Nova Instance metering

This proposal try to avoid every compute-agents polling Nova API
periodically, that will reduce the workload of Nova api caused by
compute-agents polling.

Change-Id: Icdf75c5ee01f665b40a20aa2a8bf6b42a0ad3b3d
blueprint: improve-nova-instance-metering
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/telemetry-specs refs/changes/99/209799/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================== Improve Nova Instance metering ============================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/improve-nova-instance-metering This proposal will avoid every compute-agents polling Nova API periodically. In production scenario, this change will greatly reduce the workload of Nova api caused by compute-agents polling. Problem description =================== To describe the problem, We assume we have a environment with 500 compute nodes and every compute node deployed with compute-agent (this is a real deployment scale of our company). the polling interval is set as 60s. For every polling period, compute-agent will invoke "instance_get_all_by_host()" method (and maybe need querying image and flavor also) to query the instances of this host from Nova API. That means the Nova API will receive 500 requests meanwhile every minutes. It would massively increase the workload of Nova API. In the metadata caching proposal[1], the instance info from Nova will be cached in compute-agent by using 'change-since' query filter of Nova server-list API. That will significantly decrease the amount of items of every Nova query. But that cannot help to reduce the query frequency. To dig the performance singularity of the compute-agent process, for the proposal[1] assuming we can deploy 100 instances on one host at most. we can find it is not a very significant improvement reducing 100 instances to 20 instances of every Nova list query. But it will be a significant improvement that reducing the times of Nova API requests from 500 requests/min to 1 requests/min, this is the goal of this proposal. Proposed change =============== Currently, the *instance* samples is mainly generated by compute-agent, the notification-agent also generate this samples but those will be deprecated. The *instance* metric include the info of instance from in OpenStack layer. The compute-agent is mainly used to collect the info of instance from virt layer, include the metrics of disk, cpu, net, mem, etc. According this, this proposal try to solve the problem described by two main changes: * Move the *instance* metric from compute-agent to central-agent. central-agent will use "instance_get_all" to query all instance from Nova API and generate samples "instance". The "instance_get_all" has also applied "change-since" parameter as query filter to massively reduce the amount of every query and cache the instance info didn't updated. see metadata-caching proposal [1]. * The compute-agent running on compute nodes will collector instance metrics only from virt and don't need the instance info from nova any more. Typically, the nova created instance xml from libvirt include the basic info we needed, the instance_uuid, the user_id, the project_id. For more information, please see [2]. With this basic info and the measurements by inspector querying from libvirt API, it is enough to generate the instance samples of disk, cpu, net, mem, etc. Additionally, there maybe need some other changes: * The instances in virt may not all created by OpenStack (orphan instances), these need to be dropped. The instance xml [2] include info to indicate the instance created by OpenStack Nova or not. We can also check and drop when recording samples to storage by comparing with *instance* samples recorded by central-agent. FYI: there is an old proposal for compute-agent improvement tried to do similar works, but is different, see [3]. Alternatives ------------ None. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Pipeline impact --------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance/Scalability Impacts ------------------------------- Previously, in a large-scale deployment, the all compute-agents' periodically polling requests from every compute-agent caused a heavy workload to Nova API. This proposal will change the compute-agent polling->inspecting process to avoid query instances info from Nova API. It will greatly reduce the workload of Nova API and indirectly improve the performance of environment. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: liusheng Ongoing maintainer: liusheng Work Items ---------- * Implement the instance metering in central-agent. * Implement the change in compute-agent to get rid of polling Nova API. * Enable the entry in setup.cfg and test functionality. * Add unit tests and integration tests to check the functionality. Future lifecycle ================ None Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= - The current tests will need to modify to adapt these change. - Unit tests should be add to cover these change. - Integration tests (e.g. auto-scaling) should be added or tested to test these change. Documentation Impact ==================== Documentation should be updated to add description for this. References ========== [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/185084/ [2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/408073/ [3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/101814/

commit_message:
Update puppet-swift module to current Mitaka version

Puppet-swift module doesn't contain any custom patches.
Its state is upstream state on 11 Jan (latest current commit).

Additional changes:

  * Disable mount check for swift devices

Partial implements blueprint puppet-mitaka-modules

Change-Id: Ib9571215d77f7fa3585aae32dd186a9a11520b97

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import copy from dogpile.cache import proxy from oslo_context import context as oslo_context class _ResponseCacheProxy(proxy.ProxyBackend): __key_pfx = '_request_cache_%s' def _get_request_context(self): return oslo_context.get_current() or oslo_context.RequestContext() def _get_request_key(self, key): return self.__key_pfx % key def get(self, key): ctx = self._get_request_context() try: return copy.deepcopy(getattr(ctx, self._get_request_key(key))) except AttributeError: return self.proxied.get(key) def set(self, key, value): ctx = self._get_request_context() self.proxied.set(key, value) setattr(ctx, self._get_request_key(key), copy.deepcopy(value)) ctx.update_store() def delete(self, key): ctx = self._get_request_context() try: delattr(ctx, self._get_request_key(key)) ctx.update_store() except AttributeError: pass self.proxied.delete(key) def get_multi(self, keys): # NOTE(morganfainberg): get_multi is more expensive to use, but is # not used in keystone. This is for complete implementation to ensure # we don't bypass the local request cache by accident. values = [] for key in keys: values.append(self.get(key)) return keys def set_multi(self, mapping): # TODO(morganfainberg): Implement for completeness. self.proxied.set_multi(mapping) def delete_multi(self, keys): # TODO(morganfainberg): Implement for completeness. self.proxied.delete_multi(keys)

commit_message:
Add priority to manual clean step example

clean_step decorator must have a priority argument, this change fixes
a docstring example of manual clean step that was missing it.

Change-Id: I6d6ca312fa3171026b2db427b648f7ae7273e6c2

commit_message:
Add more senlin resources to heat

Since senlin is stable now and it's time to add more senlin
resources in heat. This proposal will add senlin
node/policy/receiver resource and revise profile resource.

blueprint senlin-resources

Change-Id: I0cb83dca16bf18134ba5a99405d92e05c4b2cbe7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/49/271949/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 3. Policy --------- Namespace: OS::Senlin::Policy Required Properties: -------------------- spec: The spec template content for Senlin policy.[2]_ String Value. Optional Properties: -------------------- name: The name of the Senlin profile. String Value. Update allowed. 4. Policy Attachment -------------------- Namespace: OS::Senlin::PolicyAttachment Required Properties: -------------------- cluster: The name or id of senlin cluster. String Value. Constraint with 'senlin.cluster'. policy: The name or id of senlin policy to be associate to cluster. String Value. Constraint with 'senlin.policy'. Optional Properties: -------------------- enabled: Whether to enable this policy on the cluster. Default is True. Update allowed. 5. Node ------- Namespace: OS::Senlin::Node Required Properties: -------------------- profile: The name or id of senlin profile for this node. String Value. Constraint with 'senlin.profile'. Update allowed. Optional Properties: -------------------- cluster: The name or id of senlin cluster this node will attach to. String Value. Constraint with 'senlin.cluster'. metadata: Metadata for this node. Map Value. Update allowed. name: The name of this node. String Value. Update allowed. 6. Node Attachment ------------------ Namespace: OS::Senlin::NodeAttachment Required Properties: -------------------- cluster: The name or id of senlin cluster to attach to. String Value nodes: The list of name or id of senlin nodes to be attached to cluster. List Value. Update allowed. 7. Receiver ----------- Namespace: OS::Senlin::Receiver Required Properties: -------------------- cluster: The name or id of senlin cluster to attach to. String Value. Constraint with 'senlin.cluster'. action: The action to be executed when receive a signal. String Value. Allowed values are [CLUSTER_SCALE_OUT, CLUSTER_SCALE_IN] Optional Properties: -------------------- type: The type of receiver. String Value. Default value is 'webhook'. Allowed values are ['webhook']. name: Name of this receiver. String Value. params: The parameters passed to action when receive a signal. Map Value. .. [1] An example spec for senlin profile: https://github.com/lynic/templates/blob/master/senlin/template/senlin-profile.yaml .. commit_message:
Rename confusing dvr_deletens_if_no_port

Method name and docstring are confusing: actually it does not
delete any namespaces, just returns info about which dvr routers
should be removed from which agents.
The patch renames the method and updates it's docstring accordingly.

Change-Id: If0fde9b873961a65c2e258cdff6105889b9fbc60

commit_message:
Vagrant: Enable OVN commands to use a remote DB

Enable OVN commands to use a remote DB by setting the
OVN_NB_DB and OVN_SB_DB environment variables.

Change-Id: I70678739bb92770df1f4cefd82ce4edd996218ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/27/273227/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set the OVN_*_DB variables to enable OVN commands using a remote database. echo -e "\n# Enable OVN commands using a remote database. export OVN_NB_DB=$OVN_REMOTE export OVN_SB_DB=$OVN_REMOTE" >> ~/.bash_profile

commit_message:
Add test for stack outputs

Add test for output list and output show

Depends-On: I1bc1cee1c78ecf0c9a18ecc0a871d38e4141e0f7
Change-Id: I1ee226494b5b04ec2d43edf0c03ab31e452fedf0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/50/257350/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from heat_integrationtests.functional import functional_base class StackOutputsTest(functional_base.FunctionalTestsBase): template = ''' heat_template_version: 2014-10-16 parameters: resources: test_resource_a: type: OS::Heat::TestResource properties: value: 'a' fail: False update_replace: False wait_secs: 0 test_resource_b: type: OS::Heat::TestResource properties: value: 'b' fail: False update_replace: False wait_secs: 0 outputs: resource_id_a: description: 'ID of resource a' value: { get_attr: [test_resource_a, output] } resource_id_b: description: 'ID of resource b' value: { get_attr: [test_resource_b, output] } ''' def setUp(self): super(StackOutputsTest, self).setUp() def test_outputs(self): test_stack_name = self._stack_rand_name() stack_identifier = self.stack_create( stack_name=test_stack_name, template=self.template ) expected_list = [{u'output_key': u'resource_id_a', u'description': u'ID of resource a'}, {u'output_key': u'resource_id_b', u'description': u'ID of resource b'}] actual_list = self.client.stacks.output_list( stack_identifier)['outputs'] self.assertEqual(expected_list, actual_list) expected_output_a = { u'output_value': u'a', u'output_key': u'resource_id_a', u'description': u'ID of resource a'} expected_output_b = { u'output_value': u'b', u'output_key': u'resource_id_b', u'description': u'ID of resource b'} actual_output_a = self.client.stacks.output_show( stack_identifier, 'resource_id_a')['output'] actual_output_b = self.client.stacks.output_show( stack_identifier, 'resource_id_b')['output'] self.assertEqual(expected_output_a, actual_output_a) self.assertEqual(expected_output_b, actual_output_b)

commit_message:
Remove environment name restrictions

Since we don't use environments and environment templates names during
deployment process we don't need to check what is the name of the
environment. Now we should only keep it human-readable and check that
it exists.

Change-Id: I2d665b41deebf0c008d8b2b71802a1ab2c6673e8
Closes-Bug: #1405788

deleted_lines: NAME_VALIDATORS = [validators.RegexValidator('^[a-zA-Z]+[\w.-]*$')] ENV_NAME_HELP_TEXT = _("Environment names must contain only " "alphanumeric or '_-.' characters " "and must start with alpha") validators=NAME_VALIDATORS, error_messages={'invalid': ENV_NAME_HELP_TEXT}, max_length=255)

commit_message:
Added pool manager.

This adds classes to configure the pool manager, which was introduced in
the kilo release.

Change-Id: I57d5a1ddc49e008d8b23461d0082ecf58f452c1b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-designate refs/changes/69/209569/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # == Class designate::mdns # # Configure designate mdns service # # == Parameters # # [*package_ensure*] # (optional) The state of the package # Defaults to 'present' # # [*mdns_package_name*] # (optional) Name of the package containing mdns resources # Defaults to mdns_package_name from designate::params # # [*enabled*] # (optional) Whether to enable services. # Defaults to true # # [*service_ensure*] # (optional) Whether the designate mdns service will be running. # Defaults to 'running' # class designate::mdns ( $package_ensure = present, $manage_package = true, $mdns_package_name = undef, $enabled = true, $service_ensure = 'running', ) { include ::designate::params if $manage_package { package { 'designate-mdns': ensure => $package_ensure, name => pick($mdns_package_name, $::designate::params::mdns_service_name), tag => ['openstack', 'designate-package'], } } service { 'designate-mdns': ensure => $service_ensure, name => $::designate::params::mdns_service_name, enable => $enabled, hasstatus => true, hasrestart => true, tag => ['openstack', 'designate-service'], } }

subject: Change Swift zero-size chunk behaviour
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-27 10:56:42.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/swift/store.py', 'glance_store/tests/unit/test_swift_store.py', 'glance_store/exceptions.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance_store/commit/af44b6ef65c117a35fe2ac1bebc5b8c14d62f3fa', 'message': "Change Swift zero-size chunk behaviour

There is a difference in how Swift and radosgw behave when a zero
length write is aborted. Swift returns 499 and doesn't create an object,
but radosgw appears to creates a zero size object. Because of this, new
behaviour which was introduced to prevent zero-size chunks being written
worked for Swift, but appears not to work for the radosgw case.

This patch changes how we detect a zero size chunk so that no request
is made to the backend. We no longer rely on the Swift specific behaviour.

Conflicts:
        glance_store/_drivers/swift/store.py

Change-Id: I1a48e2eceaa6b07b8e5bbfd42fef6fd3d91f5834
Closes-bug: 1537721
"}]
commit_message:
Change Swift zero-size chunk behaviour

There is a difference in how Swift and radosgw behave when a zero
length write is aborted. Swift returns 499 and doesn't create an object,
but radosgw appears to creates a zero size object. Because of this, new
behaviour which was introduced to prevent zero-size chunks being written
worked for Swift, but appears not to work for the radosgw case.

This patch changes how we detect a zero size chunk so that no request
is made to the backend. We no longer rely on the Swift specific behaviour.

Conflicts:
        glance_store/_drivers/swift/store.py

Change-Id: I1a48e2eceaa6b07b8e5bbfd42fef6fd3d91f5834
Closes-bug: 1537721

subject: Scale back on how many warnings we issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-15 15:34:16.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/common/http.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient/commit/ae2c0995adbc71b6eed03fd11087b93acf01446a', 'message': 'Scale back on how many warnings we issue

* Remove "Request returned failure status" warning, it does not carry
  any helpful information for an operator (or anyone).
* Demote retry warnings to debug level. Retrying is essentially a normal
  thing in the real world, and currently we're spamming logs with warnings.
  http://logs.openstack.org/93/255793/3/gate/gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-agent_ssh/25175ed/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz?level=TRACE

Change-Id: I6c40581b9dc5ab1fe3af4b882ede17a13edacc66
Closes-Bug: #1525002
(cherry picked from commit 8224859c02f525fa3b7dbe917d56b889b0dbb073)
'}]
commit_message:
Scale back on how many warnings we issue

* Remove "Request returned failure status" warning, it does not carry
  any helpful information for an operator (or anyone).
* Demote retry warnings to debug level. Retrying is essentially a normal
  thing in the real world, and currently we're spamming logs with warnings.
  http://logs.openstack.org/93/255793/3/gate/gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-agent_ssh/25175ed/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz?level=TRACE

Change-Id: I6c40581b9dc5ab1fe3af4b882ede17a13edacc66
Closes-Bug: #1525002
(cherry picked from commit 8224859c02f525fa3b7dbe917d56b889b0dbb073)

added_lines: Bare Metal service comes with an example file for configuring the This file is used to redirect grub to baremetal node specific config file. It redirects it to specific grub config file based on DHCP IP assigned to baremetal node. .. literalinclude:: ../../../ironic/drivers/modules/master_grub_cfg.txt Change the permission of grub.cfg:: .. note:: If IPMI is running on a port other than 623 (the default). The port must be added to ``driver_info`` by specifying the ``ipmi_port`` value. Example: ironic node-update $NODE_UUID add driver_info/ipmi_port=$PORT_NUMBER Note that you may also specify all ``driver_info`` parameters during ``node-create`` by passing the **-i** option multiple times.
deleted_lines: Bare Metal service comes with an example file for configuring the This file is used to redirect grub to baremetal node specific config file. It redirects it to specific grub config file based on DHCP IP assigned to baremetal node. .. literalinclude:: ../../../ironic/drivers/modules/master_grub_cfg.txt Change the permission of grub.cfg::.. note:: If IPMI is running on a port other than 623 (the default). The port must be added to ``driver_info`` by specifying the ``ipmi_port`` value. Example: ironic node-update $NODE_UUID add driver_info/ipmi_port=$PORT_NUMBER Note that you may also specify all ``driver_info`` parameters during ``node-create`` by passing the **-i** option multiple times.

commit_message:
Mark shared property in Firewall unsupported

Currently shared property is removed from neutron
firewall resource, so need to mark property shared
and attribute shared from heat resource plugin unsupported.
This change is due to [1] and [2].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1465440
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/194652/

Change-Id: I166c58364a36cc3ff919e03add8c81f0f19ffab9
Closes-bug: #1537677

subject: Wrap ntpdate to timeout
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-21 12:06:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/7adf931e95e0026f7444ac8c4f611ed5caf550e6', 'message': "Wrap ntpdate in pre-deployment to timeout

Mcollective send TERM signal on retry, which can lead to problems
with non-terminated application that hangs and consequent blocking
second instance of that application which will lead to non-zero
exit and deployment blocking. Instead this we should send KILL manually
on timeout to be sure that we stop application and next instance won't
be blocked.

Change-Id: If2967106ef7267a454ca012a444eeda9b7c05793
Closes-Bug: #1533082
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-21 18:00:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/b8b0f45fd58d9358bf4963847ca217d5ed143cb7', 'message': "Wrap ntpdate in pre-deployment to timeout

Mcollective send TERM signal on retry, which can lead to problems
with non-terminated application that hangs and consequent blocking
second instance of that application which will lead to non-zero
exit and deployment blocking. Instead this we should send KILL manually
on timeout to be sure that we stop application and next instance won't
be blocked.

Change-Id: If2967106ef7267a454ca012a444eeda9b7c05793
Closes-Bug: #1533082
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-27 16:49:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/5ca34907dd7a0f1c57a658c82bda94c070c7d396', 'message': "Switch to sntp from ntpdate

commit_message:
Wrap ntpdate to timeout

As have some problems with retry hanging ntpdate outside,
wrap it to timeout with preserve status to better exit code
manage.

Change-Id: If2967106ef7267a454ca012a444eeda9b7c05793
Closes-Bug: #1533082
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/57/270757/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cmd: timeout -k25 20 ntpdate -p4 -ub -t0.2 -v -s $(awk '/^server/ { if ($2 !~ /127\.127\.[0-9]+\.[0-9]+/) {ORS=" "; print $2}}' /etc/ntp.conf)

commit_message:
Run ntpdate with strace to understand what is going on

To better catch problems related to ntpdate hangs, wrap its run
into strace session and copy output to syslog.

Change-Id: I803f190e0e43a4ab674611d316517b7de8bea76f
Related-Bug: #1533082
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/19/271219/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cmd: strace -s 512 -f -tt ntpdate -u -v $(awk '/^server/ { if ($2 !~ /127\.127\.[0-9]+\.[0-9]+/) {ORS=" "; print $2}}' /etc/ntp.conf) 2>&1 | logger -t ntpdate

subject: WIP - Adding support for Keepalived health check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-28 09:13:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/98fd7fb25825f3835c04220a281662c22e9eee2a', 'message': "WIP - Adding support for Keepalived health check

Currently we have no way of conditioning an HA router's
state with a custom events.
This is needed in some scenarios that require tracking a
specific entity (i.e. pinging a host's interface) or event
(i.e. a process that is no longer running).

This patch adds the ablitiy to hook user-defined scripts
that will be executed every interval (currently 2 sec).

These script's exit code is used by keepalived to
change the VR to FAULT state (script exited with
value other then '0' - fail)

If the VR is currently in FAULT state and the script
exited with code '0' (success) then the VR will move to
BACKUP. If the VR is MASTER and the script succeeds the
VR will remain MASTER.

The script file is defined in 'l3_agent.ini' under the new
parameter 'ha_health_check_script_path'. the file
specified in that parameter value will be used by keepalived
as a 'track_script' to be ran according to the new
'ha_health_check_script_interval' parameter in
'l3_agent.ini'. This parameter has a default value of
5 seconds.

DocImpact:
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_health_check_script_path' that can accept a full path
of a bash script. The script behavior should match the
details in this commit message above.
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_health_check_script_interval' which will determine
the VRRP health check interval in seconds.

Change-Id: Iaa9c8494f47770ab8379546a211116c17ab98a62
Closes-Bug: #1365461
Co-Authored-By:    Yoni Shafrir <yshafrir@redhat.com>
